result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert M. PESCHKA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Recording, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Employment/schooling only as directed by the agent based on the defendant's age.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Sex offender treatment.

Register as a sexual offender.

No use or possession of any internet enabled device without agent's consent.

No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without the agent's consent.

timeConds.notes:
Under the Huber Law.

Additional two (2) months in the county jail, under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert M. PESCHKA

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was discharged from probation effective 09-02-20.
Discharge Certificate.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

Motion hearing to address two motions:  1) That Manitowoc County doesn't have electronic monitoring/home-based detention and 2) Whether or not the defendant has Huber privileges.   
Counsel argue.   Court is not modifying the sentence other than the defendant has the right to Huber if he qualifes.  The Court will not be authorizing a jail transfer.   
Minutes.

Request from defendant's attorney to modify jail conditions.
Fax cover sheet.
Motion hearing at 09-24-2015 02:00 pm

The Court hereby orders that the Wisconsin Department of Justice Division of Criminal Investigation may destroy any computer electronic evidence and/or storage media which contains child pornographty.

records.addlTxt:
An Amended Information is filed which charges one count of child enticement, contrary to Section 948.07(4) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
Sentencing is set for 09-02-15 at 10:00 a.m.
The Court orders the defendant to submit to a DNA sample at this time.
Minutes.
Status conference on 06-12-15 is canceled.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 06-19-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Status conference at 06-12-2015 08:45 am

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 05-07-15 at 10:30 a.m.

Discovery Demand.  
Cover Letter.

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 03-12-15 at 10:00 a.m.  
Minutes.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant, Robert M. Peschka, is allowed to utilize the internet based web service of Netflix and such use will not constitute a violation of his condition of release.
Information filed charging 15 counts of possess child pornography, contrary to Section 948.12(1m)(3)(a) of the Wisconsin Statutes.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
Arraignment is set for 01-05-15 at 9:30 a.m.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL  
Attorney Hartley requests a modification in the bail condition to allow the defendant us of the internet to view movies on Netflix.
The State has no objection.
The Court grants the motion.
Attorney Hartley to draft the order.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 12-15-14 at 2:45 p.m.  
Minutes.
RE:  Possess child pornography, on 10-30-14.
At 1:55 p.m. search warrant with return of officer thereon.
Application for Search Warrant and Affidavit in Support of Issuance of Search Warrant; Search Warrant for residence of 1102 Westwood Lane, Manitowoc, WI.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess child pornography.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 11-17-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he have no use of the internet and not possess any internet enabled devices and that he have no contact with anyone under the age of 18.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
